CatDescriptText: Mrs. Dorothy Stanley, 7762 Calloway Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "Sure. It's all right.  It is not a question of age, but one of companionship."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy Staley, wearing knitted light colored hat, and light colored coat, standing in front of marble wall between store windows with display of hair supplies and sign that reads "% off", and "The Next 10... U.S. Population will... total population will... and 30 million more... Food Clothing Transportation Housing Medical Care Personal Care Reading and Recreation Other Goods and Services Total Consumer Spend..."
